pluggable.name: Popular Posts
pluggable.author: The Habari Community
pluggable.description: Track views of individual entries, and allow the display of most the frequently accessed entries.

help.value:
Once activated, this plugin stores and updates a view count for individual posts, and can be configured to count only users who are not logged in.

It provides a block that can be configured with the number of posts to show. Its template, block.popular_posts.php, can be copied to a theme directory and modified.

This plugin can also be used without using the block, as below:

To output a list of popular posts, insert this code where you want them to appear:

<?php $theme->popular_posts(); ?>

You can also pass the number of popular posts you want to retrieve:

<?php $theme->popular_posts( 7 ); ?>

This will retrieve the seven most popular posts. The default is five.

The default theme inserts an HTML unordered list of links to the popular pages. If you want to alter this, you should copy the popular_posts.php template included with this plugin to your current theme directory and make changes to it there.
